messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (00:57): hsivonen: yt?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (01:00): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb, http://validator.nu/?doc=http://www.xanthir.com/blog/
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:02): i wish we could make -- valid
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:02): do we really care that it's not mappable to XML?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:02): and that it causes problems in older Geckos?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:02): That was more forceful than intended.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:02): heh
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:03): So I've fixed the error I care about.  The validator can continue to complain about the line of ------ I have in a comment.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:04): anyone understand what http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=10841 is about?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:04): I think he wants the ability for captions to adjust the playback rate.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:05): i don't understand what that means
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:05): how could captions do that?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:06): Through some additional switch embedded in-band, I presume.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:06): The intent is so that with, frex, descriptions, you can have extra time to read the description while it's running.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:06): But only when you have the description track turned on.
3501532e992dae83a8bc6c811325317e (01:06): Hello. In HTML5, can I do something like <br /> without breaking validation?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:07): Yes, using a trailing slash on void elements is just fine.  It just doesn't mean anything.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:07): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: hm, interesting. thanks.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:07): Doesn't mean anything special, that is.  It's the same as <br>.

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:07): i wonder if he means that this should just be allowed in principle, or that it should be part of a specific caption format, or part of <track>, or something else
f9e12e0466f4d059b78bb3f863633092 (01:07): sans the cruft :D
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:08): oh well, i asked him to elaborate
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:08): Yeah, that's fine.  If I didn't already know what the bug was about I wouldn't be able to parse what he said.
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (01:13): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: http://microformatique.com/optimus/?format=validate&uri=http://www.xanthir.com/blog/
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (01:14): also http://lukearno.com/projects/hatom2atom/?url=http://www.xanthir.com/blog/

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:15): fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98: That validator is broken.  For one, it's telling me that things aren't specified multiple times.  For two, it's telling me that entry-title, updated, and bookmark aren't specified, then listing the entry-title, updated, and bookmark.  For 3, author is specified in the feed, outside of the entry, as allowed by the hAtom format.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:16): For the second link, are you getting anything?  I get a Python error.
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (01:16): boo. :( have you sent a bug report to the validator peeps?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:16): fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98: Not yet.  I'm just now critiquing it.  ^_^
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (01:17): re: hAtom2Atom, yeah, I'm seeing the same thing, which is why I ran your page through the validator.
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (01:17): is impatient to subscribe to your blog :)
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:17): Shortlinks first.  Then a real atom feed for you people.  Is there any standard location/filename for an atom feed?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:18): anyone got a good idea of a new example for http://www.w3.org/Bugs/Public/show_bug.cgi?id=10743 ?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:18): (that is, an example of a conformance requirement on authors that is present only to help authors avoid a brittle part of the language)
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (01:19): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: no, but you might as well mint the cleanest url possible (mine is /feed)

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:19): i.e. another example for "Errors involving fragile syntax constructs" in http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/introduction.html#syntax-errors
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:19): fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98: Makes sense.  I'll probably do /blog/atom, I guess.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:19): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e: Anything involving <p> autoclosing?
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (01:20): unquoted href with Sufficiently Weird URL in it?

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:20): i don't know that we have any conformance requirements to avoid that (the only thing that's really fragile there is  <p> bla bla \n  <ins> <p> bla bla  , and nothing is especially done to help authors avoid that issue
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:21): fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98: hmm, href=?a=b maybe
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (01:21): fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98: though that's really illegal for another reason (likely typo, not being fragile)
fd9ef1223e855714294498ebfde79f98 (01:22): something involving the AAA?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:22): Actually, that's probably a good example, since it's one of the errors the validator flagged on my site.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:22): (It wasn't a typo in my case, of course.)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:22): For those who have me on Facebook and feel helpful: http://www.facebook.com a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554/posts/448566623395

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:23): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: Seems like everything's taken care of.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:25): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: The specific post? Or does that not show?
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:25): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: I see the post.  You gave an answer, and the dude seems to have understood it.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:26): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: Permalinks are now short.  Happy?
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (01:26): 1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb: I'm too tired to try and understand people :P

1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:28): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: (Using tantek's system of a 3-digit number encoding days since the epoch in a specially-crafted sexagecimal designed for maximum readability, followed by a sexagecimal digit encoding the index of the post on that day.)
a924fb58d2c25874322f4e5126f608b9 (01:31): I hope Mark writes the HTML4 deployment post
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:37): This seems somehow wrong: <link>rel="self" href="/feed"</link>
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:37): It's from a tutorial on the Atom format.
1f8387eb43f131d7c309a90a4e36b5cb (01:37): Surely that should be <link rel="self" href="/feed" />?
